Tap_Type_and_Enter.name: Tap_Type_and_Enter
Tap_Type_and_Enter.description: Tap an input box at position (x, y), Type the "text", and then perform the Enter operation (useful for searching or sending messages).
Tap_Type_and_Enter.precondition: There is a text input box on the screen.

Reopen_And_Select_Sort_Option.name: Reopen_And_Select_Sort_Option
Reopen_And_Select_Sort_Option.description: Reopen a dropdown menu at position (dropdown_x, dropdown_y) and select an option at position (option_x, option_y).
Reopen_And_Select_Sort_Option.precondition: A dropdown menu is present on the screen, and the desired option is visible after reopening the menu.

Access_Menu_Option.name: Access_Menu_Option
Access_Menu_Option.description: Tap a menu button at position (menu_button_x, menu_button_y) and then select an option at position (option_x, option_y).
Access_Menu_Option.precondition: A menu button is visible on the screen, and the desired option is accessible after tapping the menu button.

Swipe_To_Review_Content.name: Swipe_To_Review_Content
Swipe_To_Review_Content.description: Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2) to review additional content, such as menus or reviews, when the current screen does not display all relevant information.
Swipe_To_Review_Content.precondition: The current screen contains scrollable content, and additional information is expected to be revealed by swiping.

Swipe_And_Tap.name: Swipe_And_Tap
Swipe_And_Tap.description: Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2) and then tap at position (tap_x, tap_y). Useful for navigating to hidden elements that require scrolling before tapping.
Swipe_And_Tap.precondition: The desired element is not visible on the screen and requires swiping to reveal it before tapping.

prompt_planning:
### User Instruction ###
Find me a Bakery that is within 10min drive near me and does birthday cakes on Google Maps. Find the phone number and create a new note in Notes for that.

---
Think step by step and make an high-level plan to achieve the user's instruction. If the request is complex, break it down into subgoals. If the request involves exploration, include concrete subgoals to quantify the investigation steps. The screenshot displays the starting state of the phone.

### Available Shortcuts from Past Experience ###
We additionally provide some shortcut functionalities based on past experience. These shortcuts are predefined sequences of operations that might make the plan more efficient. Each shortcut includes a precondition specifying when it is suitable for use. If your plan implies the use of certain shortcuts, ensure that the precondition is fulfilled before using them. Note that you don't necessarily need to include the names of these shortcuts in your high-level plan; they are provided as a reference.
- Tap_Type_and_Enter: Tap an input box at position (x, y), Type the "text", and then perform the Enter operation (useful for searching or sending messages). | Precondition: There is a text input box on the screen.
- Reopen_And_Select_Sort_Option: Reopen a dropdown menu at position (dropdown_x, dropdown_y) and select an option at position (option_x, option_y). | Precondition: A dropdown menu is present on the screen, and the desired option is visible after reopening the menu.
- Access_Menu_Option: Tap a menu button at position (menu_button_x, menu_button_y) and then select an option at position (option_x, option_y). | Precondition: A menu button is visible on the screen, and the desired option is accessible after tapping the menu button.
- Swipe_To_Review_Content: Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2) to review additional content, such as menus or reviews, when the current screen does not display all relevant information. | Precondition: The current screen contains scrollable content, and additional information is expected to be revealed by swiping.
- Swipe_And_Tap: Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2) and then tap at position (tap_x, tap_y). Useful for navigating to hidden elements that require scrolling before tapping. | Precondition: The desired element is not visible on the screen and requires swiping to reveal it before tapping.

---
Provide your output in the following format which contains three parts:

### Thought ###
A detailed explanation of your rationale for the plan and subgoals.

### Plan ###
1. first subgoal
2. second subgoal
...

### Current Subgoal ###
The first subgoal you should work on.
raw_response:
### Thought ###
To find a bakery within a 10-minute drive that offers birthday cakes, I will use Google Maps. After identifying a suitable bakery, I will note its phone number and create a new note in the Notes app. The process involves searching for bakeries, filtering results by proximity, checking for birthday cake services, and saving the contact information.

### Plan ###
1. Open the Google Maps app.
2. Search for "bakery near me."
3. Filter results to show bakeries within a 10-minute drive.
4. Check the details of bakeries to confirm they offer birthday cakes.
5. Note the phone number of a suitable bakery.
6. Open the Notes app and create a new note with the bakery's name and phone number.

### Current Subgoal ###
Open the Google Maps app.

If you notice an unsolved error in the previous action, think as a human user and attempt to rectify them. You must choose your action from one of the atomic actions or the shortcuts. The shortcuts are predefined sequences of actions that can be used to speed up the process. Each shortcut has a precondition specifying when it is suitable to use. If you plan to use a shortcut, ensure the current phone state satisfies its precondition first.

#### Atomic Actions ####
The atomic action functions are listed in the format of `name(arguments): description` as follows:
- Open_App(app_name): If the current screen is Home or App screen, you can use this action to open the app named "app_name" on the visible on the current screen.
- Tap(x, y): Tap the position (x, y) in current screen.
- Swipe(x1, y1, x2, y2): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2). To swipe up or down to review more content, you can adjust the y-coordinate offset based on the desired scroll distance. For example, setting x1 = x2 = 540, y1 = 1170, and y2 = 234 will swipe upwards to review additional content below. To swipe left or right in the App switcher screen to choose between open apps, set the x-coordinate offset to at least 540.
- Enter(): Press the Enter key.
- Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
- Back(): Return to the previous state.
- Home(): Return to home page.
- Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.
NOTE: Unable to type. The keyboard has not been activated. To type, please activate the keyboard by tapping on an input box or using a shortcut, which includes tapping on an input box first.”

#### Shortcuts ####
The shortcut functions are listed in the format of `name(arguments): description | Precondition: precondition` as follows:
- Tap_Type_and_Enter(x, y, text): Tap an input box at position (x, y), Type the "text", and then perform the Enter operation (useful for searching or sending messages). | Precondition: There is a text input box on the screen.
- Reopen_And_Select_Sort_Option(dropdown_x, dropdown_y, option_x, option_y): Reopen a dropdown menu at position (dropdown_x, dropdown_y) and select an option at position (option_x, option_y). | Precondition: A dropdown menu is present on the screen, and the desired option is visible after reopening the menu.
- Access_Menu_Option(menu_button_x, menu_button_y, option_x, option_y): Tap a menu button at position (menu_button_x, menu_button_y) and then select an option at position (option_x, option_y). | Precondition: A menu button is visible on the screen, and the desired option is accessible after tapping the menu button.
- Swipe_To_Review_Content(x1, y1, x2, y2): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2) to review additional content, such as menus or reviews, when the current screen does not display all relevant information. | Precondition: The current screen contains scrollable content, and additional information is expected to be revealed by swiping.
- Swipe_And_Tap(x1, y1, x2, y2, tap_x, tap_y): Swipe from position (x1, y1) to position (x2, y2) and then tap at position (tap_x, tap_y). Useful for navigating to hidden elements that require scrolling before tapping. | Precondition: The desired element is not visible on the screen and requires swiping to reveal it before tapping.

You must provide your decision using a valid JSON format specifying the name and arguments of the action. Type(text): Type the "text" in an input box.
Enter(): Press the Enter key.
Switch_App(): Show the App switcher for switching between opened apps.
Back(): Return to the previous state.
Home(): Return to home page.
Wait(): Wait for 10 seconds to give more time for a page loading.

Enter(): Press the Enter key.

Back(): Return to the previous state.
Home(): Return to home page.

A shortcut object contains the following fields: name, arguments, description, precondition, and atomic_action_sequence. The keys in the arguements need to be unique. The atomic_action_sequence is a list of dictionaries, each containing the name of an atomic action and a mapping of its atomic argument names to the shortcut's argument name. If an atomic action in the atomic_action_sequence does not take any arugments, set the `arguments_map` to an empty dict. 
IMPORTANT: The shortcut must ONLY include the Atomic Actions listed above. Create a new shortcut only if you are confident it will be useful in the future. Ensure that duplicated shortcuts with overly similar atomic action sequences are not included.
Follow the example below to format the shortcut. Avoid adding comments that could cause errors with json.loads().
 
{
    "name": "Tap_Type_and_Enter",
    "arguments": ["x", "y", "text"],
    "description": "Tap an input box at position (x, y), Type the "text", and then perform the Enter operation (useful for searching or sending messages).",
    "precondition": "There is a text input box on the screen.",
    "atomic_action_sequence":[
        {"name": "Tap", "arguments_map": {"x":"x", "y":"y"}},
        {"name": "Type", "arguments_map": {"text":"text"}},
        {"name": "Enter", "arguments_map": {}}
    ]
}


### Updated Tips ###
If you have any important new tips to add (not already included in the existing tips), combine them with the current list. If there are no new tips, simply copy the existing tips here. Keep your tips concise and general. IMPORTANT: DO NOT create shortcut names that do not exist. Add new tips only if they are essential for future interactions.
